main event: A Navy pilot reported seeing a bright object that appeared to be a star in close proximity to his aircraft, moving rapidly on a course of approximately 085 degrees true.
interesting points: The object was of a magnitude somewhat less than that of the planet Mars.
The object was visually observed for approximately 2 to 3 minutes before disappearing over the horizon.
The approximate altitude of the object at the time of sighting was 45 degrees.
The pilot's aircraft was traveling at 199 knots true at an altitude of 6,000 feet.
The weather conditions were unlimited visibility with broken cloud cover at 700 feet.
sighted object: a bright object that appeared to be a star
